HomePage.title: Experience the enchantment of the Tremiti Islands Marine Reserve
HomePage.subtitle: Mare e Stelle: boat tours to the Tremiti Islands, between unspoiled nature, island hospitality, and the timeless charm of a wooden gozzo.

section1.title: Mare e Stelle offers various services in the Tremiti Islands
section1.subtitle: Whether by sea or by land, weâ€™ll take care of making your dream vacation completely relaxingâ€¦
section1.subItem1: Vintage wooden boat, carefully restored to ensure an authentic and refined experience.
section1.subItem2: Selected itineraries through coves, caves, and pristine seabeds for an exclusive exploration of the territory.
section1.subItem4: Nautical professionals by your side since 2021

section2.title: Our Gozzo
section2.subtitle: Discover a unique way to sail, between exclusive comfort and relaxing atmospheres.
section2.altro: Free cancellation up to 48 hours in advance. What happens in case of rain? If the tour cannot take place due to bad weather (rain, rough sea, etc.), you will be contacted and can either postpone the date or receive a full refund. In case of delays from ferry companies, we cannot guarantee our service. In case of breakdowns or technical issues on board, the trip will be canceled for safety reasons and you will be entitled to a full refund. We do not offer refunds for travel expenses to the Tremiti Islands. Management declines any responsibility for malfunctions caused by accidental damage to onboard equipment. We also decline any responsibility for damage caused by other guests, weather events, natural disasters, epidemics, illnesses, and theft.

fleet.name: Morning Boat Tour
fleet.description: A 4-hour tour exploring the most beautiful coves of the Tremiti Islands. Sail aboard a vintage wooden gozzo, with stops for swimming in crystal-clear waters, moments of relaxation, and a light aperitif on board.
fleet.details: A complete excursion around the Tremiti Islands, designed to help you discover their authentic essence, among unspoiled landscapes, clear waters, and ancient history. Aboard our vintage wooden gozzo, you'll sail along the jagged coastline of the islands, stopping in the most picturesque coves for swimming or snorkeling. During the tour, the skipper will guide you with detailed explanations of the main points of interest. An experience designed for those who truly want to know the archipelago, not just admire it. The pace is slow, the sea takes center stage, and every stop is an invitation to let go.

fleet.name: Afternoon Boat Tour
fleet.description: Same route, same spirit, but with an even more peaceful atmosphere: the afternoon brings a less crowded sea and a warmer light. Between refreshing swims, relaxing aboard our wooden gozzo, and an aperitif with a view, itâ€™s the perfect opportunity to enjoy the Tremiti Islands at a slower pace.
fleet.details: A complete excursion around the Tremiti Islands, designed to help you discover their authentic essence, among unspoiled landscapes, clear waters, and ancient history. Aboard our vintage wooden gozzo, you'll sail along the jagged coastline of the islands, stopping in the most picturesque coves for swimming or snorkeling. During the tour, the skipper will guide you with detailed explanations of the main points of interest. An experience for those who truly want to get to know the archipelago, not just admire it. The pace is slow, the sea takes center stage, and every stop is an invitation to let go.

fleet.name: Sunset Experience
fleet.description: An intimate and relaxing experience designed for those who appreciate the beauty of authentic moments. The journey begins at sunset with a stop in the most picturesque coves for a refreshing swim, followed by a toast on board. Sailing between silence and reflections, youâ€™ll hear the song of the Diomedea â€” nocturnal birds symbolic of the Tremiti. As the sky darkens, the boat stops to admire the stars, far from any light pollution.

The pace is slow, the sea takes center stage, and every stop is an invitation to unwind.

services.title: Open water swimming with support boat
services.description: Tremiti Islands in total safety. Our boat follows swimmers along the agreed route, offering continuous assistance, guidance, and technical support at every stage. Perfect for training, amateur crossings, or free swimming, with the discreet but attentive presence of our experienced skipper.

testimonials.name: P R B
testimonials.title: Highly recommended
testimonials.text: Riccardo is a thoughtful guide and takes great care of his guests. His storytelling is interesting and never intrusive. He comes from a family of sailors and loves his islands. He served us a unique aperitif with delicious fish, fruit, and chilled wine. We highly recommend him, and weâ€™ll try to come back soon for another trip among coves and caves, capers and seagulls.

testimonials.name: Ornella B
testimonials.title: Beautiful!
testimonials.text: Great boat tour and spectacular views. Riccardo was really amazing. Highly recommend a boat tour with MARE E STELLE if you're visiting the Tremitiâ€”TOP ðŸ˜Š

testimonials.name: fm1270
testimonials.title: Recommended experience
testimonials.text: A day at the Tremiti with my 20-year-old daughter. Despite the strong Mistral wind, Riccardo guided us through the coves, showing us the beauty of the island. Professional and kind. Good aperitifâ€”food and wine. Great value for money. Recommended!

testimonials.name: Nadia C
testimonials.title: Super top!!!!
testimonials.text: Riccardo is super top!!!! An attentive, thorough, and very knowledgeable guide who still lets you have fun and feel safe on the boat!!! Highly recommended. Weâ€™ll definitely return from Abruzzo next time to spend more days with them!!!!! Score 10

testimonials.name: salutoni
testimonials.title: Fascinating Tremiti with a true skipper
testimonials.text: From the moment of booking, I sensed great professionalism both in providing and requesting information to better organize the tour. The professionalism stemmed from passion and love for the land, and the tour turned into awe and discovery, all accompanied by an excellent aperitif served on board. Thank you for the warmth felt through the stories and descriptions of these beautiful islands, which should be visited with respect to fully appreciate them. Thank you, Riccardo, for keeping alive the tradition and maritime expertise.

testimonials.name: Andrea
testimonials.title: Discovering the Tremiti
testimonials.text: Fantastic 4-hour boat trip discovering the Tremiti with three swim stops! Snorkeling masks are a must to enjoy this beauty! Bravo Riccardo for guiding us, explaining, and preparing an excellent and abundant aperitif on boardâ€”and for letting us taste the sailor's coffeeâ€¦ whose secret ingredient we wonâ€™t reveal :)

questions.question: Where does the tour depart from?
questions.answer: From the port of San Domino Island. Once you get off the ferry, our wooden boat is moored on the left.

questions.question: Can the tour start from San Nicola?
questions.answer: The tour departs from the port of San Domino Island. However, if you prefer to start from San Nicola, we can arrange pickup there, provided you notify us in advance by phone or email. Please inform us at least a few hours beforehand so we can organize it properly.

questions.question: How can we reach the islands to join the tour?
questions.answer: We depart from the port of San Domino. To reach us, you can book a ferry from Termoli with NLG, from Gargano with Gruppo Armatori Garganici, or a helicopter from Foggia with Alidaunia.

questions.question: Is parking easy at the port of Termoli?
questions.answer: There is a paid parking area. During high season (July and August), it's advisable to book in advance. You can do so by contacting the port ticket office.

questions.question: Is it allowed to dive from the boat?
questions.answer: For safety reasons, diving from the boat is not allowed. Boat surfaces can be slippery, especially when wet, increasing the risk of accidental falls, impacts with hard surfaces (like the edge or engine), or unsafe diving spots. Even in seemingly deep waters, hidden obstacles or sudden depth changes canâ€™t be ruled out. Legally and for insurance purposes, any unauthorized diving is the sole responsibility of the diver. Our crew is obliged to enforce all safety measures. To fully enjoy the experience safely, we schedule swim stops in safe locations where guests can enter the water comfortably using the ladder or assisted by the crew, always respecting sea conditions and regulations.

questions.question: Do I need to take off my shoes to get on board?
questions.answer: Yes, removing shoes before boarding is mandatory. This is for two main reasons: hygiene and respect for shared spacesâ€”the boat is like a home, and keeping it clean ensures comfort for everyone. Shoe soles carry sand, dirt, and debris that can damage surfaces or make them slippery. Safety is also key: going barefoot or using suitable non-slip footwear (like approved nautical socks) helps prevent slips and falls, especially on wet surfaces.

questions.question: Can I bring pets on board?
questions.answer: No, pets are not allowed on board. Our boat is shared with other guests, and to ensure everyone's comfort and well-being, pets are not permitted. This decision is based on hygiene, limited space, potential allergies, and respect for guests who may not feel comfortable around animals. Also, boat trips can be stressful for pets due to heat, noise, movement, and unfamiliar surroundings, making it neither safe nor enjoyable for them.

questions.question: What should I bring on board?
questions.answer: To make the most of your day at sea, we recommend bringing: swimsuit, sunscreen (preferably eco-friendly), sunglasses, beach towel, snorkel and mask, and water shoes. Space on board is limited, so bring only essentials in a soft, compact bag.

questions.question: Is snorkeling gear provided on board?
questions.answer: No, snorkeling equipment is not provided on board. For hygienic reasons, we do not supply masks, snorkels, or fins. These are items that come into close contact with the mouth, nose, and face, and even with thorough sanitation, we cannot guarantee the safety standards we aim to offer. Additionally, due to space and logistics, the boat cannot manage personal gear. We recommend bringing your own mask if you wish to snorkel during swim stops. Itâ€™s the safest, most comfortable, and sustainable option.

questions.question: Can I fish during the boat tour?

AboutUs.title: Who Are We?
AboutUs.subtitle: Discover the story of our family among the waves of the Tremiti Islands.
AboutUs.bannerDescription: Book your boat tour to the Tremiti Islands.

sections.title: Our Story
sections.description: Mare e Stelle is more than just a boat tour. Itâ€™s an invitation to slow down, embrace the islandâ€™s rhythm, and experience the sea as we islanders do. Each excursion lasts about 4 hours â€” just enough time to discover the most beautiful coves by sea and still enjoy some free time to explore the islands on your own, without rushing.

sections.title: On Board with Riccardo
sections.description: Your guide on this experience is Riccardo â€” skipper and host â€” ready to welcome you aboard a 70-year-old wooden boat, lovingly restored to stay true to its identity!

sections.title: Hospitality That Stays with You
sections.description: Each guest is cared for from booking to check-in to the final farewell. We donâ€™t offer a typical 'tourist' experience â€” we offer something more intimate, more personal, more real. And maybe thatâ€™s why so many come back. Because here, beyond swimming in crystal-clear waters, you breathe in a different kind of vacation â€” one that leaves a mark.

sections.title: Why 'Mare e Stelle'?
sections.description: Mare e Stelle was born from a simple yet profound idea: letting our guests live every shade of island life â€” from day to night. The sea is our element. By day it welcomes you with crystal-clear reflections, hidden coves, and the scent of Mediterranean scrub. By night, it becomes silence and poetry â€” a glowing trail in the dark and a sky full of stars you can only see far from the mainland. With Mare e Stelle, we want to share this sense of wonder â€” the same we islanders feel every time we sail these waters. To invite you to slow down, listen, observe. To feel part of a place where time doesnâ€™t rush, but is lived. Because here, every moment is precious. And those who look closely, always see more: the sea... and the stars.

sections.title: Our Wooden Gozzo
sections.description: Tradition sailing into the present. Today, most tourist boats in the Tremiti Islands are modern fiberglass or inflatable boats. But we chose a different path: to bring back to life a 70-year-old wooden fishing boat, now lovingly restored to offer you an authentic experience â€” with the charm of the past and the comfort of the present. Getting on board isnâ€™t just starting a tour â€” itâ€™s stepping into history. In the '60s and '70s, wooden hulls were everywhere here: hand-built by local master carpenters, they were silent companions of workdays. After a long restoration, our gozzo is back navigating these waters, its spirit untouched.
sections.description2: But there's more. Wood has a soul â€” something no modern material can match. Sailing on a wooden gozzo is a one-of-a-kind experience. Its heavier hull offers natural stability, perfect even in light waves. We didnâ€™t choose wood out of nostalgia, but out of love. Because how you travel matters as much as the destination. And on this boat, every wave tells a story.
list: A small fridge-bar to relax and enjoy every moment.

DiarioDiBordo.title: Captainâ€™s Log
DiarioDiBordo.subtitle: How do routes change based on the wind? Discover the paths we follow to ensure safety and wonder.
DiarioDiBordo.description: Often, the island tour changes based on the wind. Depending on sea and weather conditions, the planned route may be adjusted. Passenger safety always comes first. We aim to make 2 or 3 relaxing stops in coves along the route. These stops may vary depending on how crowded the coves are with other boats.

itineraries.title: Full Itinerary
itineraries.subtitle: Ideal Sea and Weather Conditions
itineraries.description: When the sea is calm, it is possible to complete the full tour around the archipelago. Perfect for discovering every hidden corner of the islands.

itineraries.title: Winds from the Southeast (Scirocco, Ostro, Levante)
itineraries.subtitle: Northern Route
itineraries.description: Stops in the north: Sorrentino, Cala del Cretaccio, Cala Tonda. The northern side is more sheltered and calm.

itineraries.title: Winds from the North, Northwest, West (Tramontana, Maestrale, Ponente)
itineraries.subtitle: Southern Route
itineraries.description: Relaxing stops in the southern part of the archipelago: Cala dei Pesci, Cala Matano, Cala del Sale.

itineraries.title: Winds from the Southwest (Libeccio)
itineraries.subtitle: Short and Relaxed Route
itineraries.description: Shorter route with longer stops: Cala dei Turchi, Pagliai, Cretaccio. Few sheltered coves available.
